alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:54AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Knox, southwestern Leslie and southern Clay Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 753 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cottongin, or 7 miles south of Manchester, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ogle around 800 AM EDT. Botto, Plank, Lipps, Goose Rock, Brightshade, Boho and Ice Cliff around 805 AM EDT. Ashers Fork around 810 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Creekville, Spring Creek, Marcum, Roark, Bear Branch, Big Creek, Queendale, Skidmore, Essie, Bobs Fork and Hosea. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 35 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
